meanings.definition: Relating to the creation or origin of the universe.
meanings.sent1: The scientist presented a cosmogonic theory about how the universe began.
meanings.sent2: The book discussed various cosmogonic ideas on how the universe came into existence.
meanings.sent3: The children's play had a cosmogonic theme, with the characters creating their own universe.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings were like cosmogonic visions, depicting the birth of galaxies and stars.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful visuals to explain the cosmogonic concept to the students.

meanings.sent1: The ancient texts contained cosmogonic stories that explained the origins of the world.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed artifacts with cosmogonic symbols representing the beginning of time.
meanings.sent3: The movie director added a cosmogonic touch to the film's opening scene, showing the birth of planets.
meanings.sent4: Her necklace was adorned with a cosmogonic pendant symbolizing the universe's creation.
meanings.sent5: The exhibit showcased paintings with intricate cosmogonic details illustrating the birth of the cosmos.

meanings.definition: Describing a theory or explanation of the origin of the universe.
meanings.sent1: The cosmogonic model proposed by the scientist offered a new perspective on the universe's beginning.
meanings.sent2: In class, the students debated different cosmogonic explanations for how the universe started.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about a quirky cosmogonic theory involving cosmic turtles creating the world.
meanings.sent4: The author's cosmogonic narrative captivated readers with its imaginative take on the universe's birth.
meanings.sent5: The documentary explored various cosmogonic hypotheses about the formation of galaxies and stars.
